events.name: China signs legal order for activities in disputed waters
events.wd_label: China signs legal order for activities in disputed waters
events.wd_description: President Xi of China signed a legal order allowing activities in disputed territorial waters, termed as "military activities other than war" by State Media.
events.description: President Xi of China signed a legal order allowing activities in disputed territorial waters, termed as "military activities other than war" by State Media.

events.name: China's claim to Taiwan Strait
events.wd_description: Chinese officials claimed sovereignty over the Taiwan Strait, accusing countries that see it as international waters of making false claims and threatening China's sovereignty.
events.description: Chinese officials claimed sovereignty over the Taiwan Strait, accusing countries that see it as international waters of making false claims and threatening China's sovereignty.

events.name: International navigation in Taiwan Strait
events.wd_description: Foreign nations have conducted freedom of navigation exercises in the Strait, sailing warships through the area and infuriating Beijing.
events.description: Foreign nations have conducted freedom of navigation exercises in the Strait, sailing warships through the area and infuriating Beijing.

events.name: US response to China's claim
events.wd_description: US State Department spokesperson Ned Price stated that the Strait is an international waterway with freedoms guaranteed by international law, and the US will continue to sail in accordance with international law.
events.description: US State Department spokesperson Ned Price stated that the Strait is an international waterway with freedoms guaranteed by international law, and the US will continue to sail in accordance with international law.

events.name: UK inflation rate increases to 9.1%
events.wd_description: The pace of price growth in the UK increased to 9.1% in May from 9% in April, driven primarily by the cost of fuel and energy, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS).
events.description: The pace of price growth in the UK increased to 9.1% in May from 9% in April, driven primarily by the cost of fuel and energy, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS).

events.name: Causes of inflation
events.wd_description: The main causes of inflation are the rising costs of fuel and energy.
events.description: The main causes of inflation are the rising costs of fuel and energy.

events.name: Workers and unions' response
events.wd_description: Workers and unions are fighting for pay increases to cope with rising prices.
events.description: Workers and unions are fighting for pay increases to cope with rising prices.

events.name: Government caution
events.wd_description: The government cautions against significant pay raises by employers to avoid an "inflationary spiral" similar to the 1970s.
events.description: The government cautions against significant pay raises by employers to avoid an "inflationary spiral" similar to the 1970s.

events.name: Bank of England's warning
events.wd_description: The Bank of England warned that inflation might hit 11 percent this year, the highest level since March 1982.
events.description: The Bank of England warned that inflation might hit 11 percent this year, the highest level since March 1982.

events.name: Experts' recommendation
events.wd_description: Experts suggest raising interest rates as a way to slow the rate of price growth by encouraging people to borrow less, spend less, and save more.
events.description: Experts suggest raising interest rates as a way to slow the rate of price growth by encouraging people to borrow less, spend less, and save more.

events.name: US commitment to Taiwan's defense
events.wd_description: During his tour of Asia, President Biden stated that the US is prepared to defend Taiwan if China attacks, attracting remarks from the Chinese leadership.
events.description: During his tour of Asia, President Biden stated that the US is prepared to defend Taiwan if China attacks, attracting remarks from the Chinese leadership.

events.name: Biden's statement on Taiwan
events.wd_description: President Biden compared Taiwan's situation to the tensions between Russia and Ukraine and affirmed the US's commitment to defending Taiwan.
events.description: President Biden compared Taiwan's situation to the tensions between Russia and Ukraine and affirmed the US's commitment to defending Taiwan.

events.name: Chinese response
events.wd_description: The Chinese Foreign Minister reiterated that Taiwan is inseparable from China and urged the US to abide by the One-China Principle, stating that the situation in Ukraine is not comparable to Taiwan.
events.description: The Chinese Foreign Minister reiterated that Taiwan is inseparable from China and urged the US to abide by the One-China Principle, stating that the situation in Ukraine is not comparable to Taiwan.

events.name: US-Taiwan relations
events.wd_description: While the US acknowledges the One-China Principle, the Taiwan Relations Act mandates that the US must provide Taiwan with the means to defend itself.
events.description: While the US acknowledges the One-China Principle, the Taiwan Relations Act mandates that the US must provide Taiwan with the means to defend itself.

events.name: Automakers investing in battery production
events.wd_description: Automakers are committing billions of dollars to increase battery production, with new plants being built by Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Stellantis, and Samsung.
events.description: Automakers are committing billions of dollars to increase battery production, with new plants being built by Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Stellantis, and Samsung.

events.name: Ford and General Motors
events.wd_description: Ford is building a plant in Kentucky, and General Motors is working with LG to develop a battery factory in Michigan.
events.description: Ford is building a plant in Kentucky, and General Motors is working with LG to develop a battery factory in Michigan.

events.name: Hyundai's investment
events.wd_description: Hyundai announced a $5.5 billion investment in a battery and electric vehicle plant in Georgia.
events.description: Hyundai announced a $5.5 billion investment in a battery and electric vehicle plant in Georgia.

events.name: Stellantis and Samsung's plan
events.wd_description: Stellantis and Samsung unveiled a plan to build a $2.5 billion facility in Indiana.
events.description: Stellantis and Samsung unveiled a plan to build a $2.5 billion facility in Indiana.

events.name: Current reliance on China
events.wd_description: A majority of battery cells are currently made in China, with international supply chain disruptions caused by COVID lockdowns and the war in Ukraine.
events.description: A majority of battery cells are currently made in China, with international supply chain disruptions caused by COVID lockdowns and the war in Ukraine.

events.name: Increasing control over supply chains
events.wd_description: Car companies want more control over their parts supply as EV demand grows, with the federal government also investing in supply chains.
events.description: Car companies want more control over their parts supply as EV demand grows, with the federal government also investing in supply chains.

events.name: Federal investment
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden is investing over $3 billion in the battery supply chain, with companies positioning to secure federal grants.
events.description: President Joe Biden is investing over $3 billion in the battery supply chain, with companies positioning to secure federal grants.

events.name: Transition to EVs
events.wd_description: Automakers need significant upfront investment in new machinery and factories to transition from gasoline-powered vehicles to EVs.
events.description: Automakers need significant upfront investment in new machinery and factories to transition from gasoline-powered vehicles to EVs.

events.name: Challenges in building supply chains
events.wd_description: Building factories is easier than securing access to raw materials like lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are crucial for building the supply chain.
events.description: Building factories is easier than securing access to raw materials like lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are crucial for building the supply chain.

events.name: Timeframe for building mines
events.wd_description: While it might take three to four years to build a factory, getting permits to build new lithium or nickel mines in the U.S. could take closer to 10 years.
events.description: While it might take three to four years to build a factory, getting permits to build new lithium or nickel mines in the U.S. could take closer to 10 years.
